msContents.summary: 3rd kāṇṭam of Ñāṉōpatēcam of Roberto de Nobili. It appears to be a paper copy of the early book printed in 1675-1676 (see U2, 365r6) and published in 1677-1678 at Ambalakhad, copies of which are available today in the Goa State Central Library (shelfmark "I-1a/1b Ambalacatta"; see Flüchter & Nardini 2020, note 2).

collation.desc: the front cover. Blank paper on verso. Sticker INDIEN 460.
1 unpaginated/unfoliated folio: front guard-leaf. On the recto: n. 6. in black ink, Tamoul N° 460 in black pencil. Verso blank.
2 unpaginated/unfoliated folios: front matter (f[1]r). f[1]v, f[2]rv: blank.
366 folios: main text: kāṇṭam 3 in 42 pāṭams. Tamil foliation [1], 2-366 (first folio not explicitly foliated); Arabic library foliation 1-366 in black ink.
3 unpaginated/unfoliated folios: back guard leaves. Blank recto verso.

supportDesc.condition: Good state of preservation. Binding broken.

additions.desc: Running title on top of verso pages.
Running intertitles on top of recto pages.

origin.origDate: Dated to 1720 by Cabaton (1912), on unknown grounds.

listBibl.bibl: Ñāṉōpatēcam: mūṉṟām kāṇṭam 1968. Tattuva Pōtakar aruḷiya Ñāṉōpatēca mūṉṟām kāṇṭam. Tūttukkuṭi: tamiḻ Ilakkiyak kaḻakam.
Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 65.

Flüchter, Antje & Giulia Nardini (2017). “Threefold translation of the body of Christ: concepts of the Eucharist and the body translated in the early modern missionary context.” Humanities and Social Sciences Communications (2020) 7:86 | https://doi.org/10.1057/s41599-020-00566-z

Nardini, Giulia (2017). “Roberto Nobili’s Vivāha dharma: A Case of Cultural Translation.” In: Antje Flüchter and Rouven Wirbser (ed.), Translating Catechisms, Translating Cultures: The Expansion of Catholicism in the Early Modern World (pp. 223‒251). Leiden, Boston: Brill.
